The specific group of duties or responsibilities of position.

The type of instructional or non-instructional program.
Provider of funds for the program or service.
Provider of funds for the program or service.
List all "other" Ids associated with the employee.
This field can hold a SSN, state or locally assigned Id.
Per pay distributions
Type of pay
Per pay distributions
Pay amount.
Percentage of pay this represents.
Contains information about the item being summarized.
Contains information about the item being summarized.
Classification of budgetary account code summary
Use AccountTypeDetail when AccountType is “Other”. For instance, when an AccountType=“Other”, and the AccountTypeDetail value is Long Term Asset.
Is the account a general or special account code designation?

A fund is a separate fiscal and accounting entity with a self-balancing set of accounts recording cash and other financial resources, together with all related liabilities and residual equities or balances, or changes therein, e.g. the code for Debt Service Funds, or Capital Projects Funds, or Pension Funds, to name a few examples.
State-assigned Id for the relative area in which the expenditure/revenue was used.
Relative area in which the expenditure was used.

Function break in account code for summarization. The function describes the activity for which a service or material object is acquired. (Definition from NCES, Financial Accounting for Local and State School Systems.)

Object break in account code for summarization. The function describes the activity for which a service or material object is acquired. (Definition from NCES, Financial Accounting for Local and State School Systems.)
Instructional program break in account code for summarization
Summarized amount.

An identifier for the level of instruction provided by the facility or operational unit e.g. Middle, Elementary, Prekindergarten, Charter This has greater granularity than the SIF element ExpenditureArea.
The code for a location, building, organization code, facility or site. For example, this code can identify a Charter School or Maintenance Facility.

A code used for project reporting. For instance, according to NCES, this code can be parsed to identify the particular funding source, authority, or expenditure purpose for which a special record or report is required, and to identify particular projects and the fiscal year of the appropriation within that funding source.
Codes used for recording revenue and other receivables by source, e.g. codes for Taxes Levied/Assessed by the School District, Sales and Use Taxes, code for Textbook Sales and Rentals, etc.

Balance Sheet account number used for an Asset, Liability, or Equity (equity also known as Net Asset or Fund Balance), e.g. a code for Cash in Bank, or Interfund Loans Payable, or Unreserved Fund Balance, etc.
The actual code that identifies the organization of subject matter and related learning experiences provided for the instruction of students.

A code that classifies an expense; a description of the specific group of duties and responsibilities, e.g. Staff Career Development Alternatives. (NCES, National Education Data Model, http://nces.ed.gov/forum/datamodel/eiebrowser/techview.aspx?instance=staffAssignment'amp';attrib=Professional-Educational_Job_Classification).
With regard to regional/local education service agencies report of "special" account code information, the account code summarization can be classified as:
General Ledger Amount Type. With regard to an account code grouping classified as a General Ledger account:

Value.Text: Auxiliary services of non-profit private and parochial schools

This element contains information related to curriculum standards statements "standards" or "benchmarks" or the like within the document.
A curriculum standards document or the like published by a national, state, district, school site, professional association or other interested party.
A curriculum standards document or the like published by a national, state, district, school site, professional association or other interested party.

Parent Level
Name of this type of curriculum object (e.g., "American Revolutionary War")
Describes the position of this object in the curriculum hierarchy.
Integer assigned to each hierarchical level within the CurriculumStructure tree. The top level is 1.

Used to describe what role this is serving in the structure. Some curriculum objects describe their levels in terms of programs of study, courses and units. Others use other terms. This attribute names the level of the item.
Used to describe what role this is serving in the structure. Some curriculum objects describe their levels in terms of programs of study, courses and units. Others use other terms.
CurriculumStructure objects directly above this one in the hierarchy tree. These are repeatable because a single object can have multiple parent levels in the hierarcy.
GUID assigned to the CurriculumStructure object directly above it in the hierarchy tree.
Component objects, if any, that make up this object.

The Target Object name referenced.
The RefId for the LearningResource or AssessmentItem
A number greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1. This indicates the strength of the association between the one or more Learning Standards and this target object.
The type of relationship or cardinality being modeled, e.g., predecessor, prerequisite, unidirectional, nondirectional, is a component of, etc.
Names of organizations
Name of organization
Names of authors

Copyright for a document.
Copyright date

Links to LearningStandardDocument objects
Link to LearningStandardDocument
Description of hierarchical level within standards tree.
Integer assigned to each hierarchical level within the CurriculumStructure tree. The top level is 1.
Used to describe what role this is serving in the structure. Some curriculum objects describe their levels in terms of programs of study, courses and units. Others use other terms.
A list of texts of the "standard," or "benchmark."
The text of the "standard," or "benchmark."
This element describes the unique identifier for each LearningStandard.

This represents the year that this specific learning standard was created. This is important to indicate as standards are updated to reflect the appropriate year it was created. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.
This represents the subject or content area this learning standard addresses. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.\

This is the specific number of the standard. For example, if the subject is mathematics and this standard is Patterns, Functions and Algebra, this would be StandardNumber 1. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

This represents the grade level(s) this specific learning standard will address. This may be addressed in different ways. Some states have a grade level that covers several grades and others have just one grade. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

This is the next level within the hierarchy of the learning standard. For example, if the subject is mathematics and the standard is algebra, this would be the next delineation - Represent an unknown quantity as a variable using a symbol, including letters. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.
This is the specific grade level. This is to be utilized if the GradeLevel covers several grades. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

This would be the most granular level of the learning standard associated with the grade level. Following the same example, an indicator for Algebra GradeLevel 5-7, the indicator for the benchmark above at 6 grade would be to Evaluate simple expressions by replacing variables with given values, and use formulas in problem-solving situations. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.
This element is for an organization to utilize for an internal code. This may be used for an alignment schema or other purposes that are only internal for the organization.

Name of organization represented by the document, i.e., "National Council of Teachers of Mathematics (NCTM)," "Washington," "Seattle School District." This is the name of the organization that has this AlternateIdentificationCode. This should be a text field.
A list of alphanumeric Id codes as defined by the organization to identify a statement.
An alphanumeric Id code as defined by the organization to identify a statement.
Associated LearningStandardItem objects, capturing the type of relation.
Link to associated LearningStandardItem object.

Type of the relationship between the current standard and the target standard. The value identifies the type of standard of the target item. The purpose of this information is to allow applications to sort/display these relationships in the appropriate context.

A GUID reference to the parent CurriculumStructure object of a Lesson.

Teaching strategy used in a lesson plan.

The specific end aim that is desired to achieve for the student.

The frequency in segments of time.
The actual duration of the frequency of the intervention. For example, if the student is to have the intervention for 40 minutes, then 40 would be entered.
The specific measurement goals at the end of the intervention that each student should reach.
The specific measurement goal at the end of the intervention that each student should reach.

Describes what type of assessment this represents.

Assessment was given over three days instead of in one sitting.

Description.p: This is the primary key for the list of special conditions.
In a Change event, this flag can be used to indicate an element has been deleted from the parent list container. At a minimum the key for the list must also be present.
Reference numbers for the form.
Reference number for the form.
Associated subtests (score types). Each form can provide scores in one or more subtest areas.
A subtest identified by RefId.
Choices of responses to an assessment item.
Choice of responses to an assessment item.
A choice number or other identifier for the choice. It may be used to indicate the order or grouping of the choices.
The text of the choice, such as true, 27, or Important economic and social factors.
A numeric value that indicates the amount of credit awarded for choosing the choice.
Performance Levels are an ordered set of categories that indicate the achievement level of a person on an assessment.
Defines cut scores for placing students in an appropriate performance level.
Defines cut scores for placing students in an appropriate performance level.
The name of the performance level.
Score bounds for the performance level.
Score bounds for the performance level.
The metric or scale used to report the scores.
Lower bound for the performance level.
Upper bound for the performance level.
Records student-specific special conditions during the test.
A description of the special condition. Student special conditions are different from special conditions of the test.
A code indicating the type of special condition.
The status of the student at the time of testing. The source of this information is meant to be the assessment system and not the student information system.
Person's race
Person's gender.
The person's date of birth.

Item.Description: The possible range of scores.

Description.p: The metric or scale used to report the scores.

Highest possible score value.

Item.Description: A repeating group of psychometric measures.
Container for series of item statistics.
Container for series of item statistics.
A code representing the type of statistic or analysis.
An additional description of the statistic or analysis.
The value of the Item based on this analysis
The minimum value possible for the measurement and test design.
The maximum value possible for the measurement and test design.
The optimal value for this measurement and test design.
The percent of respondents who answered correctly. This number represents the probability of the correct response to a question.
The size of the student group that saw the item.
The correlation between correct answers (dichotomous variable) on this item and total correct answers on the test.
Similar to the Point Biserial Correlation except that answers to the item are assumed to come from an underlying continuous variable.
The Index of Discrimination is the difference between the proportion of an upper group who got an item right and the proportion of a lower group who got the item right.
Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel statistic.
Mantel-Haenszel statistic.
The distribution of responses to each choice. This element only applies to multiple choice items.
